title: The Recalculation Clause
premise: When a brilliant but ruthless corporate strategist is forced to return to the small-town consulting firm she left—and the man she betrayed—to save her career, she discovers the merger she's orchestrating will dismantle his life's work. To succeed, she must choose between the empire she built on ambition and the love she sacrificed for it, all while navigating a contract with a hidden 'recalculation clause' that could rewrite both their futures.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a high-flying strategy consultant haunted by the emotional cost of her success.
conflict: Elara must execute a corporate merger that will erase the legacy of her ex-lover, Finn, and the small firm that was once her home, forcing her to confront whether the future she designed is worth the past she destroyed.
setting: Present-day, at the historic but struggling 'Hearth & Ledger' consulting firm in a lakeside town, contrasted with the cold glass towers of Manhattan corporate power.
tone: Emotionally charged, sophisticated, and bittersweet, blending the high-stakes tension of the boardroom with the aching vulnerability of a love that never fully faded.
